thread.title: Red Flash go down to wire in loss
thread.title_full: Red Flash go down to wire in loss

title: Red Flash go down to wire in loss
text:
Red Flash go down to wire in loss
From Mirror, wire reports
ERIE — Bernie Blunt’s 22 points helped Mercyhurst defeat Saint Francis 62-58 on Thursday night.
Blunt shot 8 for 19 (2 for 9 from 3-point range) and 4 of 4 from the free-throw line for the Lakers (11-13, 5-4 Northeast Conference).
Jeff Planutis shot 6 of 11 from the field, including 3 for 8 from 3-point range, and went 3 for 4 from the line to add 18 points. Aidan Reichert had 16 points and shot 5 of 9 from the field and 6 for 8 from the line.
Daemar Kelly led the Red Flash (8-15, 3-6) in scoring, finishing with 14 points. Riley Parker added 12 points and seven rebounds and Valentino Pinedo had 12 points.
The turning point in the game came when Parker hit a 3-pointer to tie the game at 56 with 61 seconds on the clock, but the Lakers scored in the lane with 31.7 seconds left to take the lead it would not relinquish.
Juan Cranford, Jr.had a 3-pointer from the corner hit the back part of the rim, and Mercyhurst came down with the rebound and made the ensuing two free throws. Kelly went coast-to-coast for a layup with 1.9 seconds left to trim the margin to 60-58 but could get no closer.
An earlier turning point came when after Pinedo gave the Red Flash a 45-44 lead with 7:37 left, the Frankies went 3:44 without a field goal.
The Lakers went on a 7-2 run in that spurt, with Pinedo making two charity tosses during the drought. Saint Francis also missed five straight free throws before the Red Flash retook the lead on Pinedo’s layup.
Saint Francis is off untilnext when it hosts Le Moyne on Thursday, Feb. 6.
ST. FRANCIS (8-15): Pinedo 4-5 4-4 12, Clayville 1-6 2-2 5, Kelly 5-8 1-2 14, Parker 5-11 0-0 12, Rosenberger 1-11 0-1 2, Cranford 0-5 2-2 2, Moncrief 2-4 0-6 4, Webb 2-2 0-0 4, Sanon 1-1 0-0 3, Harris 0-1 0-0 0. Totals 21-54 9-17 58.
MERCYHURST (11-13): Jusianiec 1-4 0-0 2, Planutis 6-11 3-4 18, Reichert 5-9 6-8 16, Blunt 8-19 4-4 22, Rathan-Mayes 2-4 0-0 4, Lemelman 0-3 0-0 0, Ivanauskas 0-3 0-0 0, Gamble 0-3 0-0 0, Thomas 0-1 0-0 0, Jackson 0-0 0-1 0. Totals 22-57 13-17 62.
Halftime–Mercyhurst 29-23. 3-Point Goals–St. Francis 7-28 (Kelly 3-6, Parker 2-5, Sanon 1-1, Clayville 1-6, Moncrief 0-2, Cranford 0-3, Rosenberger 0-5), Mercyhurst 5-24 (Planutis 3-8, Blunt 2-9, Gamble 0-1, Lemelman 0-1, Rathan-Mayes 0-1, Jusianiec 0-2, Reichert 0-2). Rebounds–St. Francis 36 (Parker 7), Mercyhurst 35 (Jusianiec, Reichert 8). Assists–St. Francis 6 (Parker 3), Mercyhurst 11 (Jusianiec, Blunt 3). Total Fouls–St. Francis 18, Mercyhurst 17. A–755
